info.label: Information
info.text: Click to view additional information about the screen and its text.

navigation.label: Navigation
navigation.text: The arrows on each sides of the screen move you either forward (right) or backward (left) in the exhibition.

chapters.label: Chapters
chapters.text: Click to view a list of all chapters and screens of the exhibition. Navigate to individual screens by clicking them.

audio.label: Audio
audio.text: This button allows you to control audio settings.

play.label: Playback
play.text: Pause the exhibition by either clicking this button or by pressing the space bar. Resume the exhibition by the same button or by pressing enter.

glass-magnifier.label: Glass magnifier
glass-magnifier.text: On some types of screens, it is possible to use the magnifying glass button, which can be used to enlarge a part of the screen content that is located under the cursor.

reactivate-tutorial.label: Recall tutorial
reactivate-tutorial.text: Use this button to recall this help.

settings.label: Settings
settings.text: Click to view and change the settings available while viewing the exhibition.

editor.label: Screen editing
editor.text: As an exhibition creator, clicking this button will redirect you to the edit page for the current screen.

progressbar.label: Rewind
progressbar.text: Some types of screens (such as video or photo gallery screens) have a special bar to help you fast forward in the current screen.

keyboard.label: Keyboard control
keyboard.text:
The exhibition can also be controlled using the keyboard. 
Press 'M' to mute all audio tracks. 
By pressing the space bar, you can pause the exhibition. 
By pressing ESC, you can close all interactive elements displayed on the screen. 
By Move forward or backwards using the arrows. 
Start the exhibition by pressing Enter.

play.label: Playback
play.text: The exhibition can be paused with this button. Pressing the button again will then resume playback.

reactivate-tutorial.label: Recall tutorial
reactivate-tutorial.text: Use this button to recall this help.

screen-info.label: Information
screen-info.text: Click to view additional information about the screen and its text.

help-tutorial-button.label: Help
help-tutorial-button.text: Some screen types have this help button, which can be used to display additional information or help on how to work with that particular screen.

overlay-button.label: Overlay
overlay-button.text: Clicking this button will open additional settings and functionalities for the current exhibition.

dragThumb.label: Slider
dragThumb.text: Drag to reveal the background image.
